notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform release 4.2.20 is now available with
updates to packages and images that fix several bugs.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform is Red Hat's cloud computing
Kubernetes application platform solution designed for on-premise or private
cloud deployments.

This advisory contains the RPM packages for Red Hat OpenShift Container
Platform 4.2.20. See the following advisory for the container images for
this release:

https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2020:0523

All OpenShift Container Platform 4.2 users are advised to upgrade to these
updated packages and images.
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

document.title: Red Hat Bug Fix Advisory: OpenShift Container Platform 4.2.20 packages update

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

notes.text: Jenkins Git Client Plugin 2.8.4 and earlier and 3.0.0-rc did not properly restrict values passed as URL argument to an invocation of 'git ls-remote', resulting in OS command injection.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jenkins-git-client-plugin: OS command injection via 'git ls-remote'
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For OpenShift Container Platform 4.2 see the following documentation, which
will be updated shortly for release 4.2.20, for important instructions on
how to upgrade your cluster and fully apply this asynchronous errata
update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.2/release_notes/ocp-4-2-release-notes.html

Details on how to access this content are available at
https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.2/updating/updating-cluster-cli.html.

vulnerabilities.title: jenkins-git-client-plugin: OS command injection via 'git ls-remote'
